body_content.explanation: in a way that relates to a province or provinces (= an area that a country is divided into as part of the organization of its government):
examples: The country has a provincially administered system of government health insurance.
Elections were held to choose 60 provincially elected members for a four-year term in the National Congress.

body_content.explanation: in a way that is provincial (= in or from the parts of a country that are not the capital city):
examples: Local politicians often act provincially, prioritizing the needs of their district over the greater good.
A number of tiny banks established by provincially based entrepreneurs could be about to fail.

body_content.explanation: in a way that is provincial (= only interested in your own country or region):
examples: Once an outward-looking country, it has become provincially inward-looking.
We have to stop thinking so provincially about healthcare and start thinking globally.
